openappsec/openappsec-rce.label: Openappsec 'rce' detection

openappsec/openappsec-request-rate-limit.name: openappsec/openappsec-request-rate-limit
openappsec/openappsec-request-rate-limit.description: Detect openappsec 'prevent' securityActions on 'Request Rate Limit' events (when waf blocks malicious request)
openappsec/openappsec-request-rate-limit.label: Openappsec 'request rate limit' detection

openappsec/openappsec-schema-validation.name: openappsec/openappsec-schema-validation
openappsec/openappsec-schema-validation.description: Detect openappsec 'prevent' securityActions on 'Schema Validation' events (when waf blocks malicious request)
openappsec/openappsec-schema-validation.label: Openappsec 'schema validations' detection

openappsec/openappsec-sql-injection.name: openappsec/openappsec-sql-injection
openappsec/openappsec-sql-injection.description: Detect openappsec 'prevent' securityActions on 'SQL Injection' events (when waf blocks malicious request)
openappsec/openappsec-sql-injection.label: Openappsec 'SQL Injection' detection

openappsec/openappsec-url-instead-of-fil.name: openappsec/openappsec-url-instead-of-file
openappsec/openappsec-url-instead-of-fil.description: Detect openappsec 'prevent' securityActions on 'URL instead of file' events (when waf blocks malicious request)
openappsec/openappsec-url-instead-of-fil.label: Openappsec 'url instead of file' detection

openappsec/openappsec-xss.name: openappsec/openappsec-xss
openappsec/openappsec-xss.description: Detect openappsec 'prevent' securityActions on 'Cross Site Scripting' events (when waf blocks malicious request)
openappsec/openappsec-xss.label: Openappsec 'XSS' detection

openappsec/openappsec-xxe.name: openappsec/openappsec-xxe
openappsec/openappsec-xxe.description: Detect openappsec 'prevent' securityActions on 'XML External Entity' events (when waf blocks malicious request)
openappsec/openappsec-xxe.label: Openappsec 'XML External Entity' detection

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_addinutil_susp.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_addinutil_suspicious_cmdline
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_addinutil_susp.description: Detects execution of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) with suspicious Addinroot or Pipelineroot paths. An adversary may execute AddinUtil.exe with uncommon Addinroot/Pipelineroot paths that point to the adversaries Addins.Store payload.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_addinutil_susp.label: Suspicious AddinUtil.EXE CommandLine Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_adplus_memory_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_adplus_memory_dump
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_adplus_memory_.description: Detects execution of "AdPlus.exe", a binary that is part of the Windows SDK that can be used as a LOLBIN in order to dump process memory and execute arbitrary commands.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_adplus_memory_.label: Potential Adplus.EXE Abuse

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_agentexecutor_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_agentexecutor_susp_usage
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_agentexecutor_.description: Detects execution of the AgentExecutor.exe binary. Which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute powershell scripts with the ExecutionPolicy "Bypass" or any binary named "powershell.exe" located in the path provided by 6th positional argument
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_agentexecutor_.label: Suspicious AgentExecutor PowerShell Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_aspnet_compile.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_aspnet_compiler_susp_child_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_aspnet_compile.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "aspnet_compiler.exe".
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_aspnet_compile.label: Suspicious Child Process of AspNetCompiler

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_aspnet_compile.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_aspnet_compiler_susp_paths
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_aspnet_compile.description: Detects execution of "aspnet_compiler.exe" with potentially suspicious paths for compilation.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_aspnet_compile.label: Potentially Suspicious ASP.NET Compilation Via AspNetCompiler

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_at_interactive.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_at_interactive_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_at_interactive.description: Detects an interactive AT job, which may be used as a form of privilege escalation.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_at_interactive.label: Interactive AT Job

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_attrib_system_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_attrib_system_susp_paths
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_attrib_system_.description: Detects the usage of attrib with the "+s" option to set scripts or executables located in suspicious locations as system files to hide them from users and make them unable to be deleted with simple rights. The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_attrib_system_.label: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_auditpol_nt_re.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_auditpol_nt_resource_kit_usage
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_auditpol_nt_re.description: Threat actors can use an older version of the auditpol binary available inside the NT resource kit to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability. This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_auditpol_nt_re.label: Audit Policy Tampering Via NT Resource Kit Auditpol

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_auditpol_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_auditpol_susp_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_auditpol_susp_.description: Threat actors can use auditpol binary to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability. This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_auditpol_susp_.label: Audit Policy Tampering Via Auditpol

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bcdedit_boot_c.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bcdedit_boot_conf_tamper
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bcdedit_boot_c.description: Detects the use of the bcdedit command to tamper with the boot configuration data. This technique is often times used by malware or attackers as a destructive way before launching ransomware.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bcdedit_boot_c.label: Boot Configuration Tampering Via Bcdedit.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bginfo_suspici.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bginfo_suspicious_child_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bginfo_suspici.description: Detects suspicious child processes of "BgInfo.exe" which could be a sign of potential abuse of the binary to proxy execution via external VBScript
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bginfo_suspici.label: Suspicious Child Process Of BgInfo.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_down.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_download_direct_ip
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_down.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file using an URL that contains an IP
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_down.label: Suspicious Download From Direct IP Via Bitsadmin

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_down.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_download_susp_extensions
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_down.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file with a suspicious extension
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_down.label: File With Suspicious Extension Downloaded Via Bitsadmin

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_down.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_download_susp_targetfolder
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_down.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file to a suspicious target folder
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_down.label: File Download Via Bitsadmin To A Suspicious Target Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chromium_headless_debugging
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.description: Detects chromium based browsers starting in headless and debugging mode and pointing to a user profile. This could be a sign of data stealing or remote control
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.label: Potential Data Stealing Via Chromium Headless Debugging

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chromium_headless_file_download
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.description: Detects execution of chromium based browser in headless mode using the "dump-dom" command line to download files
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.label: File Download with Headless Browser

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chromium_mockbin_abuse
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.description: Detects the execution of a Chromium based browser process with the "headless" flag and a URL pointing to the mockbin.org service (which can be used to exfiltrate data).
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.label: Chromium Browser Headless Execution To Mockbin Like Site

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chromium_susp_load_extension
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning a Chromium based browser process with the 'load-extension' flag to start an instance with a custom extension
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_chrom.label: Suspicious Chromium Browser Instance Executed With Custom Extension

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_tor_e.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_tor_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_tor_e.description: Detects the use of Tor or Tor-Browser to connect to onion routing networks
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_browsers_tor_e.label: Tor Client/Browser Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_calc_uncommon_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_calc_uncommon_exec
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_calc_uncommon_.description: Detects suspicious use of 'calc.exe' with command line parameters or in a suspicious directory, which is likely caused by some PoC or detection evasion.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_calc_uncommon_.label: Suspicious Calculator Usage

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certoc_downloa.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certoc_download_direct_ip
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certoc_downloa.description: Detects when a user downloads a file from an IP based URL using CertOC.exe
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certoc_downloa.label: File Download From IP Based URL Via CertOC.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certoc_load_dl.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certoc_load_dll_susp_locations
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certoc_load_dl.description: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to load the target DLL file.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certoc_load_dl.label: Suspicious DLL Loaded via CertOC.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certutil_downl.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certutil_download_direct_ip
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certutil_downl.description: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files from direct IPs.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certutil_downl.label: Suspicious File Downloaded From Direct IP Via Certutil.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certutil_ntlm_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certutil_ntlm_coercion
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certutil_ntlm_.description: Detects possible NTLM coercion via certutil using the 'syncwithWU' flag
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_certutil_ntlm_.label: Potential NTLM Coercion Via Certutil.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_citrix_trolley.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_citrix_trolleyexpress_procdump
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_citrix_trolley.description: Detects a possible process memory dump that uses the white-listed Citrix TrolleyExpress.exe filename as a way to dump the lsass process memory
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_citrix_trolley.label: Process Access via TrolleyExpress Exclusion

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_assoc_tamp.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_assoc_tamper_exe_file_association
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_assoc_tamp.description: Detects when a program changes the default file association of any extension to an executable. When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_assoc_tamp.label: Change Default File Association To Executable Via Assoc

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_copy_dmp_f.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_copy_dmp_from_share
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_copy_dmp_f.description: Detects usage of the copy builtin cmd command to copy files with the ".dmp"/".dump" extension from a remote share
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_copy_dmp_f.label: Copy .DMP/.DUMP Files From Remote Share Via Cmd.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_curl_downl.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_curl_download_exec_combo
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_curl_downl.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_curl_downl.label: Curl Download And Execute Combination

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_osk.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_osk_cmd
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_osk.description: Detects the creation of a symbolic link between "cmd.exe" and the accessibility on-screen keyboard binary (osk.exe) using "mklink". This technique provides an elevated command prompt to the user from the login screen without the need to log in.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_osk.label: Potential Privilege Escalation Using Symlink Between Osk and Cmd

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_sha.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_shadow_copies_access_symlink
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_sha.description: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_sha.label: VolumeShadowCopy Symlink Creation Via Mklink

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_net_use_an.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_net_use_and_exec_combo
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_net_use_an.description: Detects the execution of the "net use" command to mount a WebDAV server and then immediately execute some content in it. As seen being used in malicious LNK files
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_net_use_an.label: Suspicious File Execution From Internet Hosted WebDav Share

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_no_space_e.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_no_space_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_no_space_e.description: Detects Windows command lines that miss a space before or after the /c flag when running a command using the cmd.exe. This could be a sign of obfuscation of a fat finger problem (typo by the developer).
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_no_space_e.label: Cmd.EXE Missing Space Characters Execution Anomaly

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_ntdllpipe_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_ntdllpipe_redirect
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_ntdllpipe_.description: Detects command that type the content of ntdll.dll to a different file or a pipe in order to evade AV / EDR detection. As seen being used in the POC NtdllPipe
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_ntdllpipe_.label: NtdllPipe Like Activity Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_path_trave.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_path_traversal
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_path_trave.description: Detects potential path traversal attempt via cmd.exe. Could indicate possible command/argument confusion/hijacking
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_path_trave.label: Potential CommandLine Path Traversal Via Cmd.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_ping_del_c.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_ping_del_combined_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_ping_del_c.description: Detects a method often used by ransomware. Which combines the "ping" to wait a couple of seconds and then "del" to delete the file in question. Its used to hide the file responsible for the initial infection for example
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_ping_del_c.label: Suspicious Ping/Del Command Combination

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_shadowcopy.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_shadowcopy_access
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_shadowcopy.description: Detects the execution of the builtin "copy" command that targets a shadow copy (sometimes used to copy registry hives that are in use)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_shadowcopy.label: Copy From VolumeShadowCopy Via Cmd.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_key.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_key_like_backdoor_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_key.description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_key.label: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_key.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_keys_replace
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_key.description: By replacing the sticky keys executable with the local admins CMD executable, an attacker is able to access a privileged windows console session without authenticating to the system. When the sticky keys are "activated" the privilleged shell is launched.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_key.label: Persistence Via Sticky Key Backdoor

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmdkey_recon.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmdkey_recon
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmdkey_recon.description: Detects usage of cmdkey to look for cached credentials on the system
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmdkey_recon.label: Potential Reconnaissance For Cached Credentials Via Cmdkey.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmstp_executio.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmstp_execution_by_creation
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmstp_executio.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_cmstp_executio.label: CMSTP Execution Process Creation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_conhost_path_t.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_conhost_path_traversal
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_conhost_path_t.description: detects the usage of path traversal in conhost.exe indicating possible command/argument confusion/hijacking
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_conhost_path_t.label: Conhost.exe CommandLine Path Traversal

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_control_panel_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_control_panel_item
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_control_panel_.description: Detects the malicious use of a control panel item
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_control_panel_.label: Control Panel Items

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_createdump_lol.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_createdump_lolbin_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_createdump_lol.description: Detects uses of the createdump.exe LOLOBIN utility to dump process memory
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_createdump_lol.label: CreateDump Process Dump

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_csc_susp_paren.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_csc_susp_parent
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_csc_susp_paren.description: Detects a potentially suspicious parent of "csc.exe", which could be a sign of payload delivery.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_csc_susp_paren.label: Csc.EXE Execution Form Potentially Suspicious Parent

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_csi_use_of_csh.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_csi_use_of_csharp_console
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_csi_use_of_csh.description: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_csi_use_of_csh.label: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_curl_download_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_curl_download_direct_ip_susp_extensions
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_curl_download_.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads directly from IP addresses using curl.exe
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_curl_download_.label: Suspicious File Download From IP Via Curl.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_curl_susp_down.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_curl_susp_download
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_curl_susp_down.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_curl_susp_down.label: Suspicious Curl.EXE Download

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dctask64_arbit.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dctask64_arbitrary_command_and_dll_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dctask64_arbit.description: Detects the execution of "dctask64.exe", a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation part of ManageEngine Endpoint Central. This binary can be abused for DLL injection, arbitrary command and process execution.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dctask64_arbit.label: ManageEngine Endpoint Central Dctask64.EXE Potential Abuse

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_desktopimgdown.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_desktopimgdownldr_susp_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_desktopimgdown.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_desktopimgdown.label: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dism_enable_po.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dism_enable_powershell_web_access_feature
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dism_enable_po.description: Detects the use of DISM to enable the PowerShell Web Access feature, which could be used for remote access and potential abuse
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dism_enable_po.label: PowerShell Web Access Feature Enabled Via DISM

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dll_sideload_v.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dll_sideload_vmware_xfer
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dll_sideload_v.description: Detects execution of VMware Xfer utility (VMwareXferlogs.exe) from the non-default directory which may be an attempt to sideload arbitrary DLL
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dll_sideload_v.label: DLL Sideloading by VMware Xfer Utility

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dllhost_no_cli.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dllhost_no_cli_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dllhost_no_cli.description: Detects a "dllhost" process spawning with no commandline arguments which is very rare to happen and could indicate process injection activity or malware mimicking similar system processes.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dllhost_no_cli.label: Dllhost.EXE Execution Anomaly

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dns_exfiltrati.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dns_exfiltration_tools_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dns_exfiltrati.label: DNS Exfiltration and Tunneling Tools Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dns_susp_child.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dns_susp_child_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dns_susp_child.description: Detects an unexpected process spawning from dns.exe which may indicate activity related to remote code execution or other forms of exploitation as seen in CVE-2020-1350 (SigRed)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dns_susp_child.label: Unusual Child Process of dns.exe

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dnscmd_install.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dnscmd_install_new_server_level_plugin_dll
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dnscmd_install.description: Detects the installation of a DNS plugin DLL via ServerLevelPluginDll parameter in registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DNS server (restart required)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dnscmd_install.label: New DNS ServerLevelPluginDll Installed Via Dnscmd.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_driverquery_re.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_driverquery_recon
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_driverquery_re.description: Detect usage of the "driverquery" utility to perform reconnaissance on installed drivers
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_driverquery_re.label: Potential Recon Activity Using DriverQuery.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dtrace_kernel_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dtrace_kernel_dump
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dtrace_kernel_.description: Detects suspicious way to dump the kernel on Windows systems using dtrace.exe, which is available on Windows systems since Windows 10 19H1
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dtrace_kernel_.label: Suspicious Kernel Dump Using Dtrace

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dump64_defende.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dump64_defender_av_bypass_rename
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dump64_defende.description: Detects when a user is potentially trying to bypass the Windows Defender AV by renaming a tool to dump64.exe and placing it in the Visual Studio folder. Currently the rule is covering only usage of procdump but other utilities can be added in order to increase coverage.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dump64_defende.label: Potential Windows Defender AV Bypass Via Dump64.EXE Rename

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dumpminitool_s.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dumpminitool_susp_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dumpminitool_s.description: Detects suspicious ways to use the "DumpMinitool.exe" binary
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_dumpminitool_s.label: Suspicious DumpMinitool Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_esentutl_sensi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_esentutl_sensitive_file_copy
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_esentutl_sensi.description: Files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) copying
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_esentutl_sensi.label: Copying Sensitive Files with Credential Data

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_eventvwr_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_eventvwr_susp_child_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_eventvwr_susp_.description: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes of "eventvwr.exe" which might indicate a UAC bypass attempt
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_eventvwr_susp_.label: Potentially Suspicious Event Viewer Child Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_explorer_nouac.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_explorer_nouaccheck
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_explorer_nouac.description: Detects suspicious starts of explorer.exe that use the /NOUACCHECK flag that allows to run all sub processes of that newly started explorer.exe without any UAC checks
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_explorer_nouac.label: Explorer NOUACCHECK Flag

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_finger_executi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_finger_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_finger_executi.description: Detects execution of the "finger.exe" utility. Finger.EXE or "TCPIP Finger Command" is an old utility that is still present on modern Windows installation. It Displays information about users on a specified remote computer (typically a UNIX computer) that is running the finger service or daemon. Due to the old nature of this utility and the rareness of machines having the finger service. Any execution of "finger.exe" can be considered "suspicious" and worth investigating.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_netsh_fw_allow.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_netsh_fw_allow_program_in_susp_location
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_netsh_fw_allow.description: Detects Netsh command execution that whitelists a program located in a suspicious location in the Windows Firewall
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_netsh_fw_allow.label: Suspicious Program Location Whitelisted In Firewall Via Netsh.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_netsh_fw_allow.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_netsh_fw_allow_rdp
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_netsh_fw_allow.description: Detects usage of the netsh command to open and allow connections to port 3389 (RDP). As seen used by Sarwent Malware

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_netsh_port_for.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_netsh_port_forwarding_3389

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_node_abuse.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_node_abuse
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_node_abuse.description: Detects the execution node.exe which is shipped with multiple software such as VMware, Adobe...etc. In order to execute arbitrary code. For example to establish reverse shell as seen in Log4j attacks...etc
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_node_abuse.label: Potential Arbitrary Code Execution Via Node.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_nslookup_domai.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_nslookup_domain_discovery
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_nslookup_domai.description: Detects a set of suspicious network related commands often used in recon stages
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_nslookup_domai.label: Network Reconnaissance Activity

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_drive.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_driver_install_susp
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_drive.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "INSTALLDRIVER" action where the driver doesn't contain a ".dll" extension. This is often used as a defense evasion method.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_drive.label: Suspicious Driver/DLL Installation Via Odbcconf.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_exec_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_exec_susp_locations
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_exec_.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" where the path of the DLL being registered is located in a potentially suspicious location.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_exec_.label: Odbcconf.EXE Suspicious DLL Location

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_regis.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_register_dll_regsvr_susp
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_regis.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "REGSVR" action where the DLL in question doesn't contain a ".dll" extension. Which is often used as a method to evade defenses.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_regis.label: Potentially Suspicious DLL Registered Via Odbcconf.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_arbitra.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_arbitrary_cli_download
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_arbitra.description: Detects potential arbitrary file download using a Microsoft Office application
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_arbitra.label: Potential Arbitrary File Download Using Office Application

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_excel_d.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_excel_dcom_lateral_movement
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_excel_d.description: Detects suspicious child processes of Excel which could be an indicator of lateral movement leveraging the "ActivateMicrosoftApp" Excel DCOM object.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_excel_d.label: Potential Excel.EXE DCOM Lateral Movement Via ActivateMicrosoftApp

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_exec_fr.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_exec_from_trusted_locations
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_exec_fr.description: Detects the execution of an Office application that points to a document that is located in a trusted location. Attackers often used this to avoid macro security and execute their malicious code.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_exec_fr.label: Potentially Suspicious Office Document Executed From Trusted Location

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_onenote.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_onenote_embedded_script_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_onenote.description: Detects the execution of malicious OneNote documents that contain embedded scripts. When a user clicks on a OneNote attachment and then on the malicious link inside the ".one" file, it exports and executes the malicious embedded script from specific directories.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_onenote.label: OneNote.EXE Execution of Malicious Embedded Scripts

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_onenote.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_onenote_susp_child_processes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_onenote.description: Detects suspicious child processes of the Microsoft OneNote application. This may indicate an attempt to execute malicious embedded objects from a .one file.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_onenote.label: Suspicious Microsoft OneNote Child Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook_enable_unsafe_client_mail_rules
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.description: Detects an attacker trying to enable the outlook security setting "EnableUnsafeClientMailRules" which allows outlook to run applications or execute macros
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.label: Outlook EnableUnsafeClientMailRules Setting Enabled

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook_execution_from_temp
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.description: Detects a suspicious program execution in Outlook temp folder
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.label: Suspicious Execution From Outlook Temporary Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook_susp_child_processes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning from an Outlook process.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.label: Suspicious Outlook Child Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook_susp_child_processes_remote
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.description: Detects a suspicious child process spawning from Outlook where the image is located in a remote location (SMB/WebDav shares).
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.label: Suspicious Remote Child Process From Outlook

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_spawn_e.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_spawn_exe_from_users_directory
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_spawn_e.description: Detects an executable in the users directory started from one of the Microsoft Office suite applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_spawn_e.label: Suspicious Binary In User Directory Spawned From Office Application

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_susp_ch.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_susp_child_processes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_susp_ch.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning from one of the Microsoft Office suite products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio, etc.)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_susp_ch.label: Suspicious Microsoft Office Child Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ping_hex_ip.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ping_hex_ip
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ping_hex_ip.description: Detects a ping command that uses a hex encoded IP address
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ping_hex_ip.label: Ping Hex IP

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_plink_port_for.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_plink_port_forwarding
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_plink_port_for.description: Detects suspicious Plink tunnel port forwarding to a local port
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_plink_port_for.label: Suspicious Plink Port Forwarding

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_plink_susp_tun.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_plink_susp_tunneling
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_plink_susp_tun.description: Execution of plink to perform data exfiltration and tunneling
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_plink_susp_tun.label: Potential RDP Tunneling Via Plink

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_aad.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_aadinternals_cmdlets_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_aad.description: Detects ADDInternals Cmdlet execution. A tool for administering Azure AD and Office 365. Which can be abused by threat actors to attack Azure AD or Office 365.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_aad.label: AADInternals PowerShell Cmdlets Execution - ProccessCreation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_ams.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_amsi_init_failed_bypass
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_ams.description: Detects Request to "amsiInitFailed" that can be used to disable AMSI Scanning
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_ams.label: Potential AMSI Bypass Via .NET Reflection

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_base64_encoded_cmd

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.label: Suspicious Encoded PowerShell Command Line

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_base64_encoded_cmd_patterns
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.description: Detects PowerShell command line patterns in combincation with encoded commands that often appear in malware infection chains
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.label: Suspicious PowerShell Encoded Command Patterns

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_base64_encoded_obfusc
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.description: Detects suspicious UTF16 and base64 encoded and often obfuscated PowerShell code often used in command lines
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.label: Suspicious Obfuscated PowerShell Code

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_base64_frombase64string
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.description: Detects usage of a base64 encoded "FromBase64String" cmdlet in a process command line
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.label: PowerShell Base64 Encoded FromBase64String Cmdlet

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_base64_hidden_flag
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.description: Detects base64 encoded strings used in hidden malicious PowerShell command lines
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.label: Malicious Base64 Encoded PowerShell Keywords in Command Lines

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_base64_iex
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.description: Detects usage of a base64 encoded "IEX" cmdlet in a process command line
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.label: PowerShell Base64 Encoded IEX Cmdlet

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_base64_invoke
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.description: Detects UTF-8 and UTF-16 Base64 encoded powershell 'Invoke-' calls
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.label: PowerShell Base64 Encoded Invoke Keyword

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_base64_mppreference
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.description: Detects base64 encoded "MpPreference" PowerShell cmdlet code that tries to modifies or tamper with Windows Defender AV
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.label: Powershell Base64 Encoded MpPreference Cmdlet

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_base64_reflection_assembly_load
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.description: Detects base64 encoded .NET reflective loading of Assembly

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_base64_reflection_assembly_load_obfusc

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.label: Suspicious Encoded And Obfuscated Reflection Assembly Load Function Call

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_base64_wmi_classes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.description: Detects calls to base64 encoded WMI class such as "Win32_ShadowCopy", "Win32_ScheduledJob", etc.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.label: PowerShell Base64 Encoded WMI Classes

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_cmd.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_cmdline_reversed_strings
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_cmd.description: Detects the presence of reversed PowerShell commands in the CommandLine. This is often used as a method of obfuscation by attackers
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_cmd.label: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via Reversed Commands

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_cmd.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_cmdline_special_characters
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_cmd.description: Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_cmd.label: Potential PowerShell Command Line Obfuscation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dec.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_decrypt_pattern

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_def.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_defender_disable_feature
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_def.description: Detects requests to disable Microsoft Defender features using PowerShell commands
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_def.label: Powershell Defender Disable Scan Feature

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dis.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_disable_defender_av_security_monitoring
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dis.description: Detects attackers attempting to disable Windows Defender using Powershell
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dis.label: Disable Windows Defender AV Security Monitoring

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dis.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_disable_ie_features
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dis.description: Detects command lines that indicate unwanted modifications to registry keys that disable important Internet Explorer security features
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dis.label: Disabled IE Security Features

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dow.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_download_cradle_obfuscated
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dow.description: Detects the execution of a specific OneLiner to download and execute powershell modules in memory.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dow.label: Obfuscated PowerShell OneLiner Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dow.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_download_iex
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dow.description: Detects PowerShell download and execution cradles.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dow.label: PowerShell Download and Execution Cradles

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_ema.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_email_exfil
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_ema.description: Detects email exfiltration via powershell cmdlets
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_ema.label: Email Exifiltration Via Powershell

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_fro.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_frombase64string
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_fro.description: Detects usage of the "FromBase64String" function in the commandline which is used to decode a base64 encoded string
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_fro.label: Base64 Encoded PowerShell Command Detected

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_get.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_getprocess_lsass
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_get.description: Detects a "Get-Process" cmdlet and it's aliases on lsass process, which is in almost all cases a sign of malicious activity

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_hid.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_hide_services_via_set_service
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_hid.description: Detects usage of the "Set-Service" powershell cmdlet to configure a new SecurityDescriptor that allows a service to be hidden from other utilities such as "sc.exe", "Get-Service"...etc. (Works only in powershell 7)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_iex.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_iex_patterns

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_mai.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_mailboxexport_share
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_mai.description: Detects usage of the powerShell New-MailboxExportRequest Cmdlet to exports a mailbox to a remote or local share, as used in ProxyShell exploitations
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_mai.label: Suspicious PowerShell Mailbox Export to Share

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_obf.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_obfuscation_via_utf8
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_obf.description: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_obf.label: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via WCHAR

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_pub.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_public_folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_pub.label: Execution of Powershell Script in Public Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_rem.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_remotefxvgpudisablement_abuse

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_rem.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_remove_mppreference
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_rem.description: Detects attempts to remove Windows Defender configurations using the 'MpPreference' cmdlet
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_rem.label: Tamper Windows Defender Remove-MpPreference

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_rev.description: Detects usage of the "TcpClient" class. Which can be abused to establish remote connections and reverse-shells. As seen used by the Nishang "Invoke-PowerShellTcpOneLine" reverse shell and other.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_run.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_run_script_from_ads
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_run.description: Detects PowerShell script execution from Alternate Data Stream (ADS)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_run.label: Run PowerShell Script from ADS

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_run.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_run_script_from_input_stream
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_run.description: Detects PowerShell script execution via input stream redirect
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_run.label: Run PowerShell Script from Redirected Input Stream

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sam.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sam_access
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sam.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell scripts accessing SAM hives
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sam.label: PowerShell SAM Copy

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_ser.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_service_dacl_modification_set_service

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_ser.label: Suspicious Service DACL Modification Via Set-Service Cmdlet

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_set.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_set_acl
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_set.description: Detects PowerShell execution to set the ACL of a file or a folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_set.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_set_acl_susp_location
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_set.description: Detects PowerShell scripts to set the ACL to a file in the Windows folder
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_set.label: PowerShell Set-Acl On Windows Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sna.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_snapins_hafnium
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sna.description: Detects adding and using Exchange PowerShell snap-ins to export mailbox data. As seen used by HAFNIUM and APT27
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sna.label: Exchange PowerShell Snap-Ins Usage

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_susp_download_patterns
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download patterns that are often used in malicious scripts, stagers or downloaders (make sure that your backend applies the strings case-insensitive)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.label: Suspicious PowerShell Download and Execute Pattern

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_susp_parameter_variation
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.label: Suspicious PowerShell Parameter Substring

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_susp_parent_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.description: Detects a suspicious or uncommon parent processes of PowerShell
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.label: Suspicious PowerShell Parent Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_susp_ps_downloadfile

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.label: PowerShell DownloadFile

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_tok.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_token_obfuscation
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_tok.description: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_web.label: Net WebClient Casing Anomalies

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_provlaunch_sus.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_provlaunch_susp_child_process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_3proxy_exe.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_3proxy_execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_3proxy_exe.label: PUA - 3Proxy Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_adfind_enu.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_adfind_enumeration
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_adfind_enu.description: Detects active directory enumeration activity using known AdFind CLI flags
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_adfind_enu.label: PUA - Suspicious ActiveDirectory Enumeration Via AdFind.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_adfind_sus.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_adfind_susp_usage
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_adfind_sus.description: Detects AdFind execution with common flags seen used during attacks
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_adfind_sus.label: PUA - AdFind Suspicious Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_advancedru.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_advancedrun_priv_user
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_advancedru.description: Detects the execution of AdvancedRun utility in the context of the TrustedInstaller, SYSTEM, Local Service or Network Service accounts
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_advancedru.label: PUA - AdvancedRun Suspicious Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_chisel.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_chisel
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_chisel.description: Detects usage of the Chisel tunneling tool via the commandline arguments
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_chisel.label: PUA - Chisel Tunneling Tool Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_cleanwipe.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_cleanwipe
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_cleanwipe.description: Detects the use of CleanWipe a tool usually used to delete Symantec antivirus.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_cleanwipe.label: PUA - CleanWipe Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_crassus.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_crassus
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_crassus.description: Detects Crassus, a Windows privilege escalation discovery tool, based on PE metadata characteristics.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_crassus.label: PUA - Crassus Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_csexec.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_csexec
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_csexec.description: Detects the use of the lesser known remote execution tool named CsExec a PsExec alternative
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_csexec.label: PUA - CsExec Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_defenderch.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_defendercheck
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_defenderch.description: Detects the use of DefenderCheck, a tool to evaluate the signatures used in Microsoft Defender. It can be used to figure out the strings / byte chains used in Microsoft Defender to detect a tool and thus used for AV evasion.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_defenderch.label: PUA - DefenderCheck Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_ditsnap.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_ditsnap
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_ditsnap.description: Detects the use of Ditsnap tool, an inspection tool for Active Directory database, ntds.dit.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_ditsnap.label: PUA - DIT Snapshot Viewer

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_frp.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_frp
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_frp.description: Detects the use of Fast Reverse Proxy. frp is a fast reverse proxy to help you expose a local server behind a NAT or firewall to the Internet.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_frp.label: PUA - Fast Reverse Proxy (FRP) Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_iox.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_iox
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_iox.description: Detects the use of IOX - a tool for port forwarding and intranet proxy purposes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_iox.label: PUA- IOX Tunneling Tool Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_netcat.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_netcat
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_netcat.description: Detects execution of Netcat. Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_netcat.label: PUA - Netcat Suspicious Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_ngrok.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_ngrok
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_ngrok.description: Detects the use of Ngrok, a utility used for port forwarding and tunneling, often used by threat actors to make local protected services publicly available. Involved domains are bin.equinox.io for download and *.ngrok.io for connections.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_ngrok.label: PUA - Ngrok Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nimgrab.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nimgrab
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nimgrab.description: Detects the usage of nimgrab, a tool bundled with the Nim programming framework and used for downloading files.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nimgrab.label: PUA - Nimgrab Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nircmd_as_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nircmd_as_system
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nircmd_as_.description: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution as SYSTEM user
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nircmd_as_.label: PUA - NirCmd Execution As LOCAL SYSTEM

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nps.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nps
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nps.description: Detects the use of NPS, a port forwarding and intranet penetration proxy server
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nps.label: PUA - NPS Tunneling Tool Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nsudo.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nsudo
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nsudo.description: Detects the use of NSudo tool for command execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nsudo.label: PUA - NSudo Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_rclone_exe.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_rclone_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_rclone_exe.description: Detects execution of RClone utility for exfiltration as used by various ransomwares strains like REvil, Conti, FiveHands, etc
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_rclone_exe.label: PUA - Rclone Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_runxcmd.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_runxcmd
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_runxcmd.description: Detects the use of the RunXCmd tool to execute commands with System or TrustedInstaller accounts
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_runxcmd.label: PUA - RunXCmd Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_seatbelt.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_seatbelt
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_seatbelt.description: Detects the execution of the PUA/Recon tool Seatbelt via PE information of command line parameters
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_seatbelt.label: PUA - Seatbelt Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_wsudo_susp.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_wsudo_susp_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_wsudo_susp.description: Detects usage of wsudo (Windows Sudo Utility). Which is a tool that let the user execute programs with different permissions (System, Trusted Installer, Administrator...etc)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_wsudo_susp.label: PUA - Wsudo Suspicious Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_python_pty_spa.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_python_pty_spawn
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_python_pty_spa.description: Detects python spawning a pretty tty
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_python_pty_spa.label: Python Spawning Pretty TTY on Windows

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rar_compressio.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rar_compression_with_password
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rar_compressio.description: Detects the use of rar.exe, on the command line, to create an archive with password protection or with a specific compression level. This is pretty indicative of malicious actions.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rar_compressio.label: Rar Usage with Password and Compression Level

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rar_susp_greed.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rar_susp_greedy_compression
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rar_susp_greed.description: Detects RAR usage that creates an archive from a suspicious folder, either a system folder or one of the folders often used by attackers for staging purposes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rar_susp_greed.label: Suspicious Greedy Compression Using Rar.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rdrleakdiag_pr.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rdrleakdiag_process_dumping
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rdrleakdiag_pr.description: Detects the use of the Microsoft Windows Resource Leak Diagnostic tool "rdrleakdiag.exe" to dump process memory
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rdrleakdiag_pr.label: Process Memory Dump via RdrLeakDiag.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_add_safebo.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_add_safeboot
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_add_safebo.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "add" or "copy" flags on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to allow the ransomware to work in safe mode as some security products do not
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_add_safebo.label: Add SafeBoot Keys Via Reg Utility

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_bitlocker.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_bitlocker
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_bitlocker.description: Detects suspicious addition to BitLocker related registry keys via the reg.exe utility
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_bitlocker.label: Suspicious Reg Add BitLocker

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_saf.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_safeboot
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_saf.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to prevent safeboot execution of security products
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_saf.label: SafeBoot Registry Key Deleted Via Reg.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_ser.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_services
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_ser.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on services registry key. Often used by attacker to remove AV software services
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_ser.label: Service Registry Key Deleted Via Reg.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_disable_se.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_disable_sec_services
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_disable_se.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" to disable security services such as Windows Defender.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_disable_se.label: Security Service Disabled Via Reg.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_dumping_se.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_dumping_sensitive_hives
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_dumping_se.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" in order to dump sensitive registry hives. This includes SAM, SYSTEM and SECURITY hives.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_dumping_se.label: Dumping of Sensitive Hives Via Reg.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_disabl.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_disable_restricted_admin
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_disabl.description: Detects changes to the "DisableRestrictedAdmin" registry value in order to disable or enable RestrictedAdmin mode. RestrictedAdmin mode prevents the transmission of reusable credentials to the remote system to which you connect using Remote Desktop. This prevents your credentials from being harvested during the initial connection process if the remote server has been compromise
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_disabl.label: RestrictedAdminMode Registry Value Tampering - ProcCreation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_ppl_pr.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_ppl_protection_disabled
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_ppl_pr.description: Detects the usage of the "reg.exe" utility to disable PPL protection on the LSA process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_ppl_pr.label: LSA PPL Protection Disabled Via Reg.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_nolmhash.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_nolmhash
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_nolmhash.description: Detects changes to the "NoLMHash" registry value in order to allow Windows to store LM Hashes. By setting this registry value to "0" (DWORD), Windows will be allowed to store a LAN manager hash of your password in Active Directory and local SAM databases.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_nolmhash.label: Enable LM Hash Storage - ProcCreation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_rdp_keys_t.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_rdp_keys_tamper
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_rdp_keys_t.description: Detects the execution of "reg.exe" for enabling/disabling the RDP service on the host by tampering with the 'CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server' values
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_rdp_keys_t.label: Potential Tampering With RDP Related Registry Keys Via Reg.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_susp_paths.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_susp_paths
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_susp_paths.description: Detects when an adversary uses the reg.exe utility to add or modify new keys or subkeys
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_susp_paths.label: Reg Add Suspicious Paths

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_volsnap_di.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_volsnap_disable
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_volsnap_di.description: Detects commands that temporarily turn off Volume Snapshots
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_volsnap_di.label: Disabled Volume Snapshots

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_windows_de.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_windows_defender_tamper
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_windows_de.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to tamper with different Windows Defender registry keys in order to disable some important features related to protection and detection
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_windows_de.label: Suspicious Windows Defender Registry Key Tampering Via Reg.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_export.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_export_critical_keys
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_export.description: Detects the export of a crital Registry key to a file.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_export.label: Exports Critical Registry Keys To a File

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_import.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_import_keys_ads
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_import.description: Detects the import of a alternate datastream to the registry with regedit.exe.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_import.label: Imports Registry Key From an ADS

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_truste.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_trustedinstaller
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_truste.description: Detects a regedit started with TrustedInstaller privileges or by ProcessHacker.exe
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_truste.label: Regedit as Trusted Installer

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regini_ads.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regini_ads
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regini_ads.description: Detects the import of an alternate data stream with regini.exe, regini.exe can be used to modify registry keys.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regini_ads.label: Suspicious Registry Modification From ADS Via Regini.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_ie_se.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_ie_security_zone_protocol_defaults_downgrade
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_ie_se.description: Detects changes to Internet Explorer's (IE / Windows Internet properties) ZoneMap configuration of the "HTTP" and "HTTPS" protocols to point to the "My Computer" zone. This allows downloaded files from the Internet to be granted the same level of trust as files stored locally.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_ie_se.label: IE ZoneMap Setting Downgraded To MyComputer Zone For HTTP Protocols Via CLI

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_insta.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_install_reg_debugger_backdoor
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_insta.description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_insta.label: Suspicious Debugger Registration Cmdline

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_logon.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_logon_script
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_logon.description: Detects the addition of a new LogonScript to the registry value "UserInitMprLogonScript" for potential persistence
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_logon.label: Potential Persistence Via Logon Scripts - CommandLine

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_new_n.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_new_network_provider
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_new_n.description: Detects when an attacker tries to add a new network provider in order to dump clear text credentials, similar to how the NPPSpy tool does it
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_new_n.label: Potential Credential Dumping Attempt Using New NetworkProvider - CLI

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_offic.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_office_disable_python_security_warnings
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_offic.description: Detects changes to the registry value "PythonFunctionWarnings" that would prevent any warnings or alerts from showing when Python functions are about to be executed. Threat actors could run malicious code through the new Microsoft Excel feature that allows Python to run within the spreadsheet.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_offic.label: Python Function Execution Security Warning Disabled In Excel

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_privi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_privilege_escalation_via_service_key
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_privi.description: Detect modification of services configuration (ImagePath, FailureCommand and ServiceDLL) in registry by processes with Medium integrity level
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_privi.label: Potential Privilege Escalation via Service Permissions Weakness

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_provl.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_provlaunch_provisioning_command
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_provl.description: Detects potential abuse of the provisioning registry key for indirect command execution through "Provlaunch.exe".
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_provl.label: Potential Provisioning Registry Key Abuse For Binary Proxy Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_set_u.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_set_unsecure_powershell_policy
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_set_u.description: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy registry key in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution from the CommandLine
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_set_u.label: Potential PowerShell Execution Policy Tampering - ProcCreation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_http_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_http_ip_pattern
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_http_.description: Detects regsvr32 execution to download and install DLLs located remotely where the address is an IP address.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_http_.label: Potentially Suspicious Regsvr32 HTTP IP Pattern

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_remot.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_remote_share
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_remot.description: Detects REGSVR32.exe to execute DLL hosted on remote shares
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_remot.label: Suspicious Regsvr32 Execution From Remote Share

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_child_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "regsvr32.exe".
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_.label: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of Regsvr32

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_exec_path_2
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_.description: Detects execution of regsvr32 where the DLL is located in a highly suspicious locations
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_.label: Regsvr32 Execution From Highly Suspicious Location

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_extensions
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_.description: Detects the execution of REGSVR32.exe with DLL files masquerading as other files
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_.label: Regsvr32 DLL Execution With Suspicious File Extension

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_remote_access_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_remote_access_tools_anydesk_silent_install
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_remote_access_.description: Detects AnyDesk Remote Desktop silent installation. Which can be used by attackers to gain remote access.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_remote_access_.label: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Silent Installation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_remote_access_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_remote_access_tools_anydesk_susp_exec
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_remote_access_.description: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks. These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment. Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_remote_access_.label: Remote Access Tool - Anydesk Execution From Suspicious Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_adfind.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_adfind
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_adfind.description: Detects the use of a renamed Adfind.exe. AdFind continues to be seen across majority of breaches. It is used to domain trust discovery to plan out subsequent steps in the attack chain.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_adfind.label: Renamed AdFind Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_autoit.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_autoit
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_autoit.description: Detects the execution of a renamed AutoIt2.exe or AutoIt3.exe. AutoIt is a scripting language and automation tool for Windows systems. While primarily used for legitimate automation tasks, it can be misused in cyber attacks. Attackers can leverage AutoIt to create and distribute malware, including keyloggers, spyware, and botnets. A renamed AutoIt executable is particularly suspicious.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_autoit.label: Renamed AutoIt Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_binary.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_binary_highly_relevant
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_binary.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_binary.label: Potential Defense Evasion Via Rename Of Highly Relevant Binaries

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_browse.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_browsercore
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_browse.description: Detects process creation with a renamed BrowserCore.exe (used to extract Azure tokens)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_browse.label: Renamed BrowserCore.EXE Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_cloudf.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_cloudflared
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_cloudf.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "cloudflared" binary.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_cloudf.label: Renamed Cloudflared.EXE Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_create.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_createdump
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_create.description: Detects uses of a renamed legitimate createdump.exe LOLOBIN utility to dump process memory
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_create.label: Renamed CreateDump Utility Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_dctask.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_dctask64
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_dctask.description: Detects a renamed "dctask64.exe" execution, a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation part of ManageEngine Endpoint Central. This binary can be abused for DLL injection, arbitrary command and process execution.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_dctask.label: Renamed ZOHO Dctask64 Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_gpg4wi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_gpg4win
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_gpg4wi.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "gpg.exe". Often used by ransomware and loaders to decrypt/encrypt data.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_gpg4wi.label: Renamed Gpg.EXE Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_jusche.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_jusched
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_jusche.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "jusched.exe" as seen used by the cobalt group
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_jusche.label: Renamed Jusched.EXE Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_mavinj.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_mavinject
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_mavinj.description: Detects the execution of a renamed version of the "Mavinject" process. Which can be abused to perform process injection using the "/INJECTRUNNING" flag
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_mavinj.label: Renamed Mavinject.EXE Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_megasy.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_megasync
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_megasy.description: Detects the execution of a renamed MegaSync.exe as seen used by ransomware families like Nefilim, Sodinokibi, Pysa, and Conti.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_megasy.label: Renamed MegaSync Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_msdt.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_msdt
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_msdt.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "Msdt.exe" binary
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_msdt.label: Renamed Msdt.EXE Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_netsup.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_netsupport_rat

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_plink.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_plink
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_plink.description: Detects the execution of a renamed version of the Plink binary
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_plink.label: Renamed Plink Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_rundll.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_rundll32_dllregisterserver

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysint.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysinternals_debugview

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysint.label: Renamed SysInternals DebugView Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysint.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysinternals_procdump
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysint.description: Detects the execution of a renamed ProcDump executable. This often done by attackers or malware in order to evade defensive mechanisms.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysint.label: Renamed ProcDump Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysint.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysinternals_psexec_service

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysint.label: Renamed PsExec Service Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysint.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysinternals_sdelete
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysint.description: Detects the use of a renamed SysInternals Sdelete, which is something an administrator shouldn't do (the renaming)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysint.label: Renamed Sysinternals Sdelete Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_vmnat.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_vmnat
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_vmnat.description: Detects renamed vmnat.exe or portable version that can be used for DLL side-loading
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_vmnat.label: Renamed Vmnat.exe Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_whoami.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_whoami
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_whoami.description: Detects the execution of whoami that has been renamed to a different name to avoid detection
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_whoami.label: Renamed Whoami Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_ads_s.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_ads_stored_dll_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_ads_s.description: Detects execution of rundll32 where the DLL being called is stored in an Alternate Data Stream (ADS).
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_ads_s.label: Potential Rundll32 Execution With DLL Stored In ADS

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_advpa.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_advpack_obfuscated_ordinal_call
