sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_advpa.label: Suspicious Advpack Call Via Rundll32.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_inlin.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_inline_vbs
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_inlin.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that invokes inline VBScript as seen being used by UNC2452
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_inlin.label: Suspicious Rundll32 Invoking Inline VBScript

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_keymg.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_keymgr
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_keymg.description: Detects the invocation of the Stored User Names and Passwords dialogue (Key Manager)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_keymg.label: Suspicious Key Manager Access

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_mshtm.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_mshtml_runhtmlapplication
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_mshtm.description: Detects execution of commands that leverage the "mshtml.dll" RunHTMLApplication export to run arbitrary code via different protocol handlers (vbscript, javascript, file, http...)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_mshtm.label: Mshtml.DLL RunHTMLApplication Suspicious Usage

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_no_pa.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_no_params
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_no_pa.description: Detects suspicious start of rundll32.exe without any parameters as found in CobaltStrike beacon activity
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_no_pa.label: Rundll32 Execution Without CommandLine Parameters

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_ntlmr.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_ntlmrelay
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_ntlmr.description: Detects a privilege elevation attempt by coercing NTLM authentication on the Printer Spooler service
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_ntlmr.label: Suspicious NTLM Authentication on the Printer Spooler Service

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_proce.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_process_dump_via_comsvcs
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_proce.description: Detects a process memory dump via "comsvcs.dll" using rundll32, covering multiple different techniques (ordinal, minidump function, etc.)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_proce.label: Process Memory Dump Via Comsvcs.DLL

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_shell.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_shell32_susp_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_shell.description: Detects shell32.dll executing a DLL in a suspicious directory
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_shell.label: Shell32 DLL Execution in Suspicious Directory

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_spawn.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_spawn_explorer
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_spawn.description: Detects RunDLL32.exe spawning explorer.exe as child, which is very uncommon, often observes Gamarue spawning the explorer.exe process in an unusual way
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_spawn.label: RunDLL32 Spawning Explorer

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_control_dll_load
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.description: Detects suspicious Rundll32 execution from control.exe as used by Equation Group and Exploit Kits
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.label: Suspicious Control Panel DLL Load

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_execution_with_image_extension
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.description: Detects the execution of Rundll32.exe with DLL files masquerading as image files
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.label: Suspicious Rundll32 Execution With Image Extension

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_shellexec_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.description: Detects suspicious usage of the ShellExec_RunDLL function to launch other commands as seen in the the raspberry-robin attack
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.label: Suspicious Usage Of ShellExec_RunDLL

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_shimcache_flush
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.description: Detects actions that clear the local ShimCache and remove forensic evidence
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.label: ShimCache Flush

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_sys.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_sys
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_sys.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that includes a *.sys file as seen being used by UNC2452
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_sys.label: Suspicious Rundll32 Activity Invoking Sys File

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_unc_p.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_unc_path
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_unc_p.description: Detects rundll32 execution where the DLL is located on a remote location (share)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_unc_p.label: Rundll32 UNC Path Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_webda.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_webdav_client_susp_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_webda.description: Detects "svchost.exe" spawning "rundll32.exe" with command arguments like C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie. This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on WebDav Server) or potentially a sign of exploitation of CVE-2023-23397
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_webda.label: Suspicious WebDav Client Execution Via Rundll32.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_witho.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_without_parameters
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_witho.description: Detects rundll32 execution without parameters as observed when running Metasploit windows/smb/psexec exploit module
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_witho.label: Rundll32 Execution Without Parameters

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_change_sevi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_change_sevice_image_path_by_non_admin
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_change_sevi.description: Detection of sc.exe utility spawning by user with Medium integrity level to change service ImagePath or FailureCommand
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_change_sevi.label: Possible Privilege Escalation via Weak Service Permissions

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_allow.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_allow_service_changes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_allow.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to allow access to a service from a suspicious trustee. This can be used to override access restrictions set by previous ACLs.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_allow.label: Allow Service Access Using Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_deny_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_deny_service_access
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_deny_.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to deny access to a service that affects critical trustees. This can be used to hide services or make them unstoppable.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_deny_.label: Deny Service Access Using Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_hide_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_hide_sevices
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_hide_.description: Detects usage of the "sc.exe" utility adding a new service with special permission seen used by threat actors which makes the service hidden and unremovable.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_hide_.label: Service DACL Abuse To Hide Services Via Sc.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_service_pat.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_service_path_modification
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_service_pat.description: Detects service path modification via the "sc" binary to a suspicious command or path
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_service_pat.label: Suspicious Service Path Modification

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_appda.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_appdata_local_system
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_appda.description: Detects the creation of a schtask that executes a file from C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_appda.label: Suspicious Schtasks Execution AppData Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_chang.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_change
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_chang.description: Detects when an attacker tries to modify an already existing scheduled tasks to run from a suspicious location Attackers can create a simple looking task in order to avoid detection on creation as it's often the most focused on Instead they modify the task after creation to include their malicious payload
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_chang.label: Suspicious Modification Of Scheduled Tasks

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_creat.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_creation_temp_folder
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_creat.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involves a temporary folder and runs only once
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_creat.label: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation Involving Temp Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_delet.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_delete
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_delet.description: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by deleting their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_delet.label: Delete Important Scheduled Task

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_delet.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_delete_all
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_delet.description: Detects the usage of schtasks with the delete flag and the asterisk symbol to delete all tasks from the schedule of the local computer, including tasks scheduled by other users.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_delet.label: Delete All Scheduled Tasks

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_disab.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_disable
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_disab.description: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by disabling their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_disab.label: Disable Important Scheduled Task

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_folde.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_folder_combos
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_folde.description: Detects scheduled task creations that have suspicious action command and folder combinations
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_folde.label: Schtasks From Suspicious Folders

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_one_t.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_one_time_only_midnight_task
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_one_t.description: Detects scheduled task creation events that include suspicious actions, and is run once at 00:00
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_one_t.label: Uncommon One Time Only Scheduled Task At 00:00

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_power.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_powershell_persistence
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_power.description: Detects suspicious powershell execution via a schedule task where the command ends with an suspicious flags to hide the powershell instance instead of executeing scripts or commands. This could be a sign of persistence via PowerShell "Get-Variable" technique as seen being used in Colibri Loader
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_power.label: Potential Persistence Via Powershell Search Order Hijacking - Task

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_reg_l.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_reg_loader_encoded
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_reg_l.description: Detects the creation of a schtask that potentially executes a base64 encoded payload stored in the Windows Registry using PowerShell.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_reg_l.label: Scheduled Task Executing Encoded Payload from Registry

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_sched.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_schedule_type
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_sched.description: Detects scheduled task creations or modification on a suspicious schedule type
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_sched.label: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Types

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_syste.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_system
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_syste.description: Detects the creation or update of a scheduled task to run with "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" privileges
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_syste.label: Schtasks Creation Or Modification With SYSTEM Privileges

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_scrcons_susp_c.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_scrcons_susp_child_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_scrcons_susp_c.description: Detects a suspicious child process of Script Event Consumer (scrcons.exe).
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_scrcons_susp_c.label: Script Event Consumer Spawning Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sdiagnhost_sus.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sdiagnhost_susp_child
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sdiagnhost_sus.description: Detects sdiagnhost.exe calling a suspicious child process (e.g. used in exploits for Follina / CVE-2022-30190)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sdiagnhost_sus.label: Sdiagnhost Calling Suspicious Child Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_servu_susp_chi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_servu_susp_child_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_servu_susp_chi.description: Detects a suspicious process pattern which could be a sign of an exploited Serv-U service
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_servu_susp_chi.label: Suspicious Serv-U Process Pattern

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_setres_uncommo.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_setres_uncommon_child_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_setres_uncommo.description: Detects uncommon child process of Setres.EXE. Setres.EXE is a Windows server only process and tool that can be used to set the screen resolution. It can potentially be abused in order to launch any arbitrary file with a name containing the word "choice" from the current execution path.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_setres_uncommo.label: Uncommon Child Process Of Setres.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_splwow64_cli_a.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_splwow64_cli_anomaly
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_splwow64_cli_a.description: Detects suspicious Splwow64.exe process without any command line parameters
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_splwow64_cli_a.label: Suspicious Splwow64 Without Params

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_spoolsv_susp_c.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_spoolsv_susp_child_processes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_spoolsv_susp_c.description: Detects suspicious print spool service (spoolsv.exe) child processes.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_spoolsv_susp_c.label: Suspicious Spool Service Child Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlcmd_veeam_d.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlcmd_veeam_dump
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlcmd_veeam_d.description: Detects dump of credentials in VeeamBackup dbo
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlcmd_veeam_d.label: VeeamBackup Database Credentials Dump Via Sqlcmd.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlite_chromiu.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlite_chromium_profile_data
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlite_chromiu.description: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Chromium-based browsers for potential data stealing.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlite_chromiu.label: SQLite Chromium Profile Data DB Access

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlite_firefox.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlite_firefox_gecko_profile_data
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlite_firefox.description: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Firefox and other Gecko-based browsers for potential data stealing.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlite_firefox.label: SQLite Firefox Profile Data DB Access

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ssh_rdp_tunnel.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ssh_rdp_tunneling
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ssh_rdp_tunnel.description: Execution of ssh.exe to perform data exfiltration and tunneling through RDP
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ssh_rdp_tunnel.label: Potential RDP Tunneling Via SSH

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_stordiag_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_stordiag_susp_child_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_stordiag_susp_.description: Detects the use of stordiag.exe to execute schtasks.exe systeminfo.exe and fltmc.exe
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_stordiag_susp_.label: Execution via stordiag.exe

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_abusing_d.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_abusing_debug_privilege
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_abusing_d.description: Detection of unusual child processes by different system processes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_abusing_d.label: Abused Debug Privilege by Arbitrary Parent Processes

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_privileged_group
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_.description: Detects addition of users to highly privileged groups via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_.label: User Added To Highly Privileged Group

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_remote_desktop_group
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_.description: Detects addition of users to the local Remote Desktop Users group via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_.label: User Added to Remote Desktop Users Group

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_archiver_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_archiver_iso_phishing
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_archiver_.description: Detects cases in which an ISO files is opend within an archiver like 7Zip or Winrar, which is a sign of phishing as threat actors put small ISO files in archives as email attachments to bypass certain filters and protective measures (mark of web)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_archiver_.label: Phishing Pattern ISO in Archive

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_child_pro.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_child_process_as_system_
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_child_pro.description: Detection of child processes spawned with SYSTEM privileges by parents with LOCAL SERVICE or NETWORK SERVICE accounts
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_child_pro.label: Suspicious Child Process Created as System

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_cli_obfus.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_cli_obfuscation_unicode_img
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_cli_obfus.description: Detects potential commandline obfuscation using unicode characters. Adversaries may attempt to make an executable or file difficult to discover or analyze by encrypting, encoding, or otherwise obfuscating its contents on the system or in transit.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_cli_obfus.label: Potential CommandLine Obfuscation Using Unicode Characters From Suspicious Image

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_copy_syst.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_copy_system_dir_lolbin
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_copy_syst.description: Detects a suspicious copy operation that tries to copy a known LOLBIN from system (System32, SysWOW64, WinSxS) directories to another on disk in order to bypass detections based on locations.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_copy_syst.label: LOL-Binary Copied From System Directory

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_crypto_mi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_crypto_mining_monero
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_crypto_mi.description: Detects command line parameters or strings often used by crypto miners
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_crypto_mi.label: Potential Crypto Mining Activity

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_data_exfi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_data_exfiltration_via_cli
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_data_exfi.description: Detects the use of various CLI utilities exfiltrating data via web requests
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_data_exfi.label: Potential Data Exfiltration Activity Via CommandLine Tools

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_disable_r.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_disable_raccine
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_disable_r.description: Detects commands that indicate a Raccine removal from an end system. Raccine is a free ransomware protection tool.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_disable_r.label: Raccine Uninstall

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_double_ex.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_double_extension
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_double_ex.description: Detects suspicious use of an .exe extension after a non-executable file extension like .pdf.exe, a set of spaces or underlines to cloak the executable file in spear phishing campaigns
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_double_ex.label: Suspicious Double Extension File Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_double_ex.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_double_extension_parent
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_double_ex.description: Detect execution of suspicious double extension files in ParentCommandLine
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_double_ex.label: Suspicious Parent Double Extension File Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_download_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_download_office_domain
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_download_.description: Detects suspicious ways to download files from Microsoft domains that are used to store attachments in Emails or OneNote documents
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_download_.label: Suspicious Download from Office Domain

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_dumpstack.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_dumpstack_log_evasion
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_dumpstack.description: Detects the use of the filename DumpStack.log to evade Microsoft Defender
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_dumpstack.label: DumpStack.log Defender Evasion

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usage_in_cli_1
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.label: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 1

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usage_in_cli_2
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.label: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 2

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usage_in_cli_3
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.label: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 3

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usage_in_cli_4
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.label: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 4

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_etw_modif.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_etw_modification_cmdline
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_etw_modif.description: Detects changes to environment variables related to ETW logging via the CommandLine. This could indicate potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_etw_modif.label: ETW Logging Tamper In .NET Processes Via CommandLine

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_etw_trace.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_etw_trace_evasion
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_etw_trace.description: Detects command line activity that tries to clear or disable any ETW trace log which could be a sign of logging evasion.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_etw_trace.label: ETW Trace Evasion Activity

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_eventlog_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_eventlog_clear
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_eventlog_.description: Detects the clearing or configuration tampering of EventLog using utilities such as "wevtutil", "powershell" and "wmic". This technique were seen used by threat actors and ransomware strains in order to evade defenses.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_eventlog_.label: Suspicious Eventlog Clearing or Configuration Change Activity

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_execution.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_execution_from_public_folder_as_parent
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_execution.description: Detects a potentially suspicious execution of a parent process located in the "\Users\Public" folder executing a child process containing references to shell or scripting binaries and commandlines.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_execution.label: Potentially Suspicious Execution From Parent Process In Public Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_execution.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_execution_path
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_execution.description: Detects a potentially suspicious execution from an uncommon folder.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_execution.label: Process Execution From A Potentially Suspicious Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_gather_ne.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_gather_network_info_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_gather_ne.description: Detects execution of the built-in script located in "C:\Windows\System32\gatherNetworkInfo.vbs". Which can be used to gather information about the target machine
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_gather_ne.label: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity Via GatherNetworkInfo.VBS

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_image_mis.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_image_missing
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_image_mis.description: Checks whether the image specified in a process creation event is not a full, absolute path (caused by process ghosting or other unorthodox methods to start a process)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_image_mis.label: Execution Of Non-Existing File

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_inline_ba.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_inline_base64_mz_header
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_inline_ba.description: Detects encoded base64 MZ header in the commandline
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_inline_ba.label: Base64 MZ Header In CommandLine

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_inline_wi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_inline_win_api_access
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_inline_wi.description: Detects the use of WinAPI Functions via the commandline. As seen used by threat actors via the tool winapiexec
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_inline_wi.label: Potential WinAPI Calls Via CommandLine

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_lsass_dmp.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_lsass_dmp_cli_keywords
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_lsass_dmp.description: Detects the presence of the keywords "lsass" and ".dmp" in the commandline, which could indicate a potential attempt to dump or create a dump of the lsass process.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_lsass_dmp.label: LSASS Dump Keyword In CommandLine

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_non_priv_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_non_priv_reg_or_ps
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_non_priv_.description: Search for usage of reg or Powershell by non-privileged users to modify service configuration in registry
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_non_priv_.label: Non-privileged Usage of Reg or Powershell

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_ntds.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_ntds
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_ntds.description: Detects suspicious process patterns used in NTDS.DIT exfiltration
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_ntds.label: Suspicious Process Patterns NTDS.DIT Exfil

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_nteventlo.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_nteventlogfile_usage
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_nteventlo.description: Detects usage of the WMI class "Win32_NTEventlogFile" in a potentially suspicious way (delete, backup, change permissions, etc.) from a PowerShell script
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_nteventlo.label: Potentially Suspicious Call To Win32_NTEventlogFile Class

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_parents.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_parents
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_parents.description: Detects suspicious parent processes that should not have any children or should only have a single possible child program
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_parents.label: Suspicious Process Parents

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_powershel.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_powershell_execution_via_dll
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_powershel.description: Detects potential PowerShell execution from a DLL instead of the usual PowerShell process as seen used in PowerShdll. This detection assumes that PowerShell commands are passed via the CommandLine.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_powershel.label: Potential PowerShell Execution Via DLL

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_priv_esca.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_priv_escalation_via_named_pipe
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_priv_esca.description: Detects a remote file copy attempt to a hidden network share. This may indicate lateral movement or data staging activity.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_priv_esca.label: Privilege Escalation via Named Pipe Impersonation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_progname.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_progname
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_progname.description: Detects suspicious patterns in program names or folders that are often found in malicious samples or hacktools
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_progname.label: Suspicious Program Names

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_recycle_b.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_recycle_bin_fake_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_recycle_b.description: Detects process execution from a fake recycle bin folder, often used to avoid security solution.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_recycle_b.label: Suspicious Process Execution From Fake Recycle.Bin Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_redirect_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_redirect_local_admin_share
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_redirect_.description: Detects a suspicious output redirection to the local admins share, this technique is often found in malicious scripts or hacktool stagers
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_redirect_.label: Suspicious Redirection to Local Admin Share

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_right_to_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_right_to_left_override
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_right_to_.description: Detects the presence of the "u202+E" character, which causes a terminal, browser, or operating system to render text in a right-to-left sequence. This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_right_to_.label: Potential Defense Evasion Via Right-to-Left Override

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_script_ex.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_script_exec_from_env_folder
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_script_ex.description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_script_ex.label: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_script_ex.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_script_exec_from_temp
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_script_ex.description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_script_ex.label: Suspicious Script Execution From Temp Folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_sensitive.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_sensitive_file_access_shadowcopy
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_sensitive.description: Detects a command that accesses the VolumeShadowCopy in order to extract sensitive files such as the Security or SAM registry hives or the AD database (ntds.dit)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_sensitive.label: Sensitive File Access Via Volume Shadow Copy Backup

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_c.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_creation
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_c.description: Detects creation of a new service via "sc" command or the powershell "new-service" cmdlet with suspicious binary paths
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_c.label: Suspicious New Service Creation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_d.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_dir
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_d.description: Detects a service binary running in a suspicious directory
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_d.label: Suspicious Service Binary Directory

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_t.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_tamper
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_t.description: Detects the usage of binaries such as 'net', 'sc' or 'powershell' in order to stop, pause, disable or delete critical or important Windows services such as AV, Backup, etc. As seen being used in some ransomware scripts
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_t.label: Suspicious Windows Service Tampering

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_shadow_co.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_shadow_copies_deletion
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_shadow_co.description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_shadow_co.label: Shadow Copies Deletion Using Operating Systems Utilities

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_shell_spa.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_shell_spawn_susp_program
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_shell_spa.description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_shell_spa.label: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_system_us.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_system_user_anomaly
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_system_us.description: Detects a suspicious process creation as SYSTEM user (suspicious program or command line parameter)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_system_us.label: Suspicious SYSTEM User Process Creation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_task_fold.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_task_folder_evasion
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_task_fold.description: The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths. Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_task_fold.label: Tasks Folder Evasion

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_whoami_as.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_whoami_as_param
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_whoami_as.description: Detects a suspicious process command line that uses whoami as first parameter (as e.g. used by EfsPotato)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_whoami_as.label: WhoAmI as Parameter

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_workfolde.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_workfolders
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_workfolde.description: Detects using WorkFolders.exe to execute an arbitrary control.exe
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_workfolde.label: Execution via WorkFolders.exe

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_svchost_execut.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_svchost_execution_with_no_cli_flags
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_svchost_execut.description: It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_svchost_execut.label: Suspect Svchost Activity

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_svchost_termse.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_svchost_termserv_proc_spawn
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_svchost_termse.description: Detects a process spawned by the terminal service server process (this could be an indicator for an exploitation of CVE-2019-0708)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_svchost_termse.label: Terminal Service Process Spawn

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_a.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_adexplorer_susp_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_a.description: Detects the execution of Sysinternals ADExplorer with the "-snapshot" flag in order to save a local copy of the active directory database to a suspicious directory.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_a.label: Suspicious Active Directory Database Snapshot Via ADExplorer

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_procdump_evasion
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.description: Detects uses of the SysInternals ProcDump utility in which ProcDump or its output get renamed, or a dump file is moved or copied to a different name
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.label: Potential SysInternals ProcDump Evasion

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_procdump_lsass
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.description: Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter in combination with the lsass.exe process. This way we are also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.label: Potential LSASS Process Dump Via Procdump

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_psexec_paexec_escalate_system
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.description: Detects suspicious commandline flags used by PsExec and PAExec to escalate a command line to LOCAL_SYSTEM rights
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.label: PsExec/PAExec Escalation to LOCAL SYSTEM

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_psexec_remote_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.description: Detects potential psexec command that initiate execution on a remote systems via common commandline flags used by the utility
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.label: Potential PsExec Remote Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_psexesvc_as_system
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.description: Detects suspicious launch of the PSEXESVC service on this system and a sub process run as LOCAL_SYSTEM (-s), which means that someone remotely started a command on this system running it with highest privileges and not only the privileges of the login user account (e.g. the administrator account)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.label: PsExec Service Child Process Execution as LOCAL SYSTEM

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pssuspend_susp_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.description: Detects suspicious execution of Sysinternals PsSuspend, where the utility is used to suspend critical processes such as AV or EDR to bypass defenses
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.label: Sysinternals PsSuspend Suspicious Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_s.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_sdelete
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_s.description: Detects the use of SDelete to erase a file not the free space
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_s.label: Potential File Overwrite Via Sysinternals SDelete

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_s.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_susp_psexec_paexec_flags
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_s.description: Detects unknown program using commandline flags usually used by tools such as PsExec and PAExec to start programs with SYSTEM Privileges
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_s.label: Potential Privilege Escalation To LOCAL SYSTEM

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_s.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_sysmon_uninstall
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_s.description: Detects the removal of Sysmon, which could be a potential attempt at defense evasion
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_s.label: Uninstall Sysinternals Sysmon

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_systemsettings.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_systemsettingsadminflows_turn_on_dev_features
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_systemsettings.description: Detects when a user enable developer features such as "Developer Mode" or "Application Sideloading". Which allows the user to install untrusted packages.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_systemsettings.label: Potential Signing Bypass Via Windows Developer Features

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_taskkill_sep.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_taskkill_sep
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_taskkill_sep.description: Detects one of the possible scenarios for disabling Symantec Endpoint Protection. Symantec Endpoint Protection antivirus software services incorrectly implement the protected service mechanism. As a result, the NT AUTHORITY/SYSTEM user can execute the taskkill /im command several times ccSvcHst.exe /f, thereby killing the process belonging to the service, and thus shutting down the service.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_taskkill_sep.label: Taskkill Symantec Endpoint Protection

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_taskmgr_locals.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_taskmgr_localsystem
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_taskmgr_locals.description: Detects the creation of taskmgr.exe process in context of LOCAL_SYSTEM
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_taskmgr_locals.label: Taskmgr as LOCAL_SYSTEM

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_tscon_localsys.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_tscon_localsystem
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_tscon_localsys.description: Detects a tscon.exe start as LOCAL SYSTEM
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_tscon_localsys.label: Suspicious TSCON Start as SYSTEM

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_tscon_rdp_redi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_tscon_rdp_redirect
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_tscon_rdp_redi.description: Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_tscon_rdp_redi.label: Suspicious RDP Redirect Using TSCON

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cha.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_changepk_slui
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cha.description: Detects an UAC bypass that uses changepk.exe and slui.exe (UACMe 61)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cha.label: UAC Bypass Using ChangePK and SLUI

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cle.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cleanmgr
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cle.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using scheduled tasks and variable expansion of cleanmgr.exe (UACMe 34)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cle.label: UAC Bypass Using Disk Cleanup

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cms.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cmstp
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cms.description: Detect commandline usage of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer (cmstp.exe) to install specially formatted local .INF files
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cms.label: Bypass UAC via CMSTP

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cms.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cmstp_com_object_access
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cms.description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects (e.g. UACMe ID of 41, 43, 58 or 65)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cms.label: CMSTP UAC Bypass via COM Object Access

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_com.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_computerdefaults
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_com.description: Detects tools such as UACMe used to bypass UAC with computerdefaults.exe (UACMe 59)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_com.label: UAC Bypass Tools Using ComputerDefaults

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_con.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_consent_comctl32
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_con.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using consent.exe and comctl32.dll (UACMe 22)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_con.label: UAC Bypass Using Consent and Comctl32 - Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_dis.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_dismhost
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_dis.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using DismHost DLL hijacking (UACMe 63)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_dis.label: UAC Bypass Using DismHost

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_eve.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_eventvwr_recentviews
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_eve.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Event Viewer RecentViews
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_eve.label: UAC Bypass Using Event Viewer RecentViews

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_fod.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_fodhelper
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_fod.description: Identifies use of Fodhelper.exe to bypass User Account Control. Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_fod.label: Bypass UAC via Fodhelper.exe

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_icm.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_icmluautil
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_icm.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using ICMLuaUtil Elevated COM interface
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_icm.label: UAC Bypass via ICMLuaUtil

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_iei.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_ieinstal
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_iei.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using IEInstal.exe (UACMe 64)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_iei.label: UAC Bypass Using IEInstal - Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_msc.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_msconfig_gui
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_msc.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a msconfig GUI hack (UACMe 55)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_msc.label: UAC Bypass Using MSConfig Token Modification - Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_ntf.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_ntfs_reparse_point
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_ntf.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using NTFS reparse point and wusa.exe DLL hijacking (UACMe 36)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_ntf.label: UAC Bypass Using NTFS Reparse Point - Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_pkg.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_pkgmgr_dism
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_pkg.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using pkgmgr.exe and dism.exe (UACMe 23)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_pkg.label: UAC Bypass Using PkgMgr and DISM

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_tru.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_trustedpath
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_tru.description: Detects indicators of a UAC bypass method by mocking directories
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_tru.label: TrustedPath UAC Bypass Pattern

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_win.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_winsat
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_win.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_win.label: UAC Bypass Abusing Winsat Path Parsing - Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wmp.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wmp
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wmp.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wmp.label: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsr.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsreset
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsr.description: Detects use of WSReset.exe to bypass User Account Control (UAC). Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsr.label: Bypass UAC via WSReset.exe

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsr.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsreset_integrity_level
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsr.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass via WSReset usable by default sysmon-config
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsr.label: UAC Bypass WSReset

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ultravnc_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ultravnc_susp_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ultravnc_susp_.description: Detects suspicious UltraVNC command line flag combination that indicate a auto reconnect upon execution, e.g. startup (as seen being used by Gamaredon threat group)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ultravnc_susp_.label: Suspicious UltraVNC Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uninstall_crow.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uninstall_crowdstrike_falcon
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uninstall_crow.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by uninstalling Crowdstrike Falcon
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uninstall_crow.label: Uninstall Crowdstrike Falcon Sensor

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_userinit_uncom.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_userinit_uncommon_child_processes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_userinit_uncom.description: Detects uncommon "userinit.exe" child processes, which could be a sign of uncommon shells or login scripts used for persistence.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_userinit_uncom.label: Uncommon Userinit Child Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vmware_toolbox.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vmware_toolbox_cmd_persistence_susp
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vmware_toolbox.description: Detects execution of the "VMwareToolBoxCmd.exe" with the "script" and "set" flag to setup a specific script that's located in a potentially suspicious location to run for a specific VM state
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vmware_toolbox.label: Suspicious Persistence Via VMwareToolBoxCmd.EXE VM State Change Script

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vmware_vmtools.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vmware_vmtoolsd_susp_child_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vmware_vmtools.description: Detects suspicious child process creations of VMware Tools process which may indicate persistence setup
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vmware_vmtools.label: VMToolsd Suspicious Child Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vscode_tunnel_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vscode_tunnel_renamed_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vscode_tunnel_.description: Detects renamed Visual Studio Code tunnel execution. Attackers can abuse this functionality to establish a C2 channel
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vscode_tunnel_.label: Renamed Visual Studio Code Tunnel Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_w32tm.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_w32tm
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_w32tm.description: When configured with suitable command line arguments, w32tm can act as a delay mechanism
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_w32tm.label: Use of W32tm as Timer

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wab_execution_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wab_execution_from_non_default_location
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wab_execution_.description: Detects execution of wab.exe (Windows Contacts) and Wabmig.exe (Microsoft Address Book Import Tool) from non default locations as seen with bumblebee activity
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wab_execution_.label: Wab Execution From Non Default Location

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wab_unusual_pa.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wab_unusual_parents
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wab_unusual_pa.description: Detects unusual parent or children of the wab.exe (Windows Contacts) and Wabmig.exe (Microsoft Address Book Import Tool) processes as seen being used with bumblebee activity
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wab_unusual_pa.label: Wab/Wabmig Unusual Parent Or Child Processes

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wbadmin_delete.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wbadmin_delete_all_backups
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wbadmin_delete.description: Detects the deletion of all backups or system state backups via "wbadmin.exe". This technique is used by numerous ransomware families and actors. This may only be successful on server platforms that have Windows Backup enabled.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wbadmin_delete.label: All Backups Deleted Via Wbadmin.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_chopp.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_chopper
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_chopp.description: Detects patterns found in process executions cause by China Chopper like tiny (ASPX) webshells
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_chopp.label: Chopper Webshell Process Pattern

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_hacki.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_hacking
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_hacki.description: Detects certain parent child patterns found in cases in which a web shell is used to perform certain credential dumping or exfiltration activities on a compromised system
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_hacki.label: Webshell Hacking Activity Patterns

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_recon.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_recon_commands_and_processes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_recon.description: Detects certain command line parameters often used during reconnaissance activity via web shells
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_recon.label: Webshell Detection With Command Line Keywords

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_susp_process_spawned_from_webserver
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_susp_.description: Detects potentially suspicious processes being spawned by a web server process which could be the result of a successfully placed web shell or exploitation
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_susp_.label: Suspicious Process By Web Server Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_tool_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_tool_recon
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_tool_.description: Detects processes spawned from web servers (PHP, Tomcat, IIS, etc.) that perform reconnaissance looking for the existence of popular scripting tools (perl, python, wget) on the system via the help commands
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_tool_.label: Webshell Tool Reconnaissance Activity

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_werfault_lsass.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_werfault_lsass_shtinkering
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_werfault_lsass.description: Detects potential credential dumping via Windows Error Reporting LSASS Shtinkering technique which uses the Windows Error Reporting to dump lsass
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_werfault_lsass.label: Potential Credential Dumping Via WER

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wermgr_susp_ex.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wermgr_susp_exec_location
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wermgr_susp_ex.description: Detects suspicious Windows Error Reporting manager (wermgr.exe) execution location.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wermgr_susp_ex.label: Suspicious Execution Location Of Wermgr.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wget_download_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wget_download_direct_ip
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wget_download_.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads directly from IP addresses using Wget.exe
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wget_download_.label: Suspicious File Download From IP Via Wget.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_whoami_executi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_whoami_execution_from_high_priv_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_whoami_executi.description: Detects the execution of "whoami.exe" by privileged accounts that are often abused by threat actors
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_whoami_executi.label: Whoami.EXE Execution From Privileged Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_whoami_priv_di.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_whoami_priv_discovery
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_whoami_priv_di.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed with the /priv command line flag instructing the tool to show all current user privileges. This is often used after a privilege escalation attempt.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_whoami_priv_di.label: Security Privileges Enumeration Via Whoami.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_winget_add_ins.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_winget_add_insecure_custom_source
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_winget_add_ins.description: Detects usage of winget to add a new insecure (http) download source. Winget will not allow the addition of insecure sources, hence this could indicate potential suspicious activity (or typos)
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_winget_add_ins.label: Add Insecure Download Source To Winget

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_winrm_susp_chi.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_winrm_susp_child_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_winrm_susp_chi.description: Detects suspicious processes including shells spawnd from WinRM host process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_winrm_susp_chi.label: Suspicious Processes Spawned by WinRM

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmi_backdoor_e.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmi_backdoor_exchange_transport_agent
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmi_backdoor_e.description: Detects a WMI backdoor in Exchange Transport Agents via WMI event filters
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmi_backdoor_e.label: WMI Backdoor Exchange Transport Agent

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_eventcons.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_eventconsumer_creation
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_eventcons.description: Detects WMIC executions in which an event consumer gets created. This could be used to establish persistence
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_eventcons.label: New ActiveScriptEventConsumer Created Via Wmic.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_namespace.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_namespace_defender
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_namespace.description: Detects potential tampering with Windows Defender settings such as adding exclusion using wmic
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_namespace.label: Potential Windows Defender Tampering Via Wmic.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_exec.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_execution_via_office_process
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_exec.description: Office application called wmic to proxye execution through a LOLBIN process. This is often used to break suspicious parent-child chain (Office app spawns LOLBin).
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_exec.label: Suspicious WMIC Execution Via Office Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_proc.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_process_creation
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_proc.description: Detects WMIC executing "process call create" with suspicious calls to processes such as "rundll32", "regsrv32", etc.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_proc.label: Suspicious Process Created Via Wmic.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_uninstall.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_uninstall_security_products
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_uninstall.description: Detects uninstallation or termination of security products using the WMIC utility
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_uninstall.label: Potential Tampering With Security Products Via WMIC

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmiprvse_susp_.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmiprvse_susp_child_processes
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmiprvse_susp_.description: Detects suspicious and uncommon child processes of WmiPrvSE
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmiprvse_susp_.label: Suspicious WmiPrvSE Child Process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wpbbin_potenti.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wpbbin_potential_persistence
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wpbbin_potenti.description: Detects execution of the binary "wpbbin" which is used as part of the UEFI based persistence method described in the reference section
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wpbbin_potenti.label: UEFI Persistence Via Wpbbin - ProcessCreation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wscript_cscrip.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wscript_cscript_uncommon_extension_exec
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wscript_cscrip.description: Detects Wscript/Cscript executing a file with an uncommon (i.e. non-script) extension
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wscript_cscrip.label: Cscript/Wscript Uncommon Script Extension Execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_dll_lo.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_dll_loading
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_dll_lo.description: Detects the use of the Windows Update Client binary (wuauclt.exe) for proxy execution.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_dll_lo.label: Proxy Execution Via Wuauclt.EXE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_no_cli.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_no_cli_flags_execution
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_no_cli.description: Detects suspicious Windows Update Agent activity in which a wuauclt.exe process command line doesn't contain any command line flags
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_no_cli.label: Suspicious Windows Update Agent Empty Cmdline

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wusa_cab_files.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wusa_cab_files_extraction_from_susp_paths
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wusa_cab_files.description: Detects the execution of the "wusa.exe" (Windows Update Standalone Installer) utility to extract ".cab" files using the "/extract" argument from potentially suspicious paths.
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wusa_cab_files.label: Cab File Extraction Via Wusa.EXE From Potentially Suspicious Paths

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_xwizard_execut.name: sigmahq/proc_creation_win_xwizard_execution_non_default_location
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_xwizard_execut.description: Detects the execution of Xwizard tool from a non-default directory. When executed from a non-default directory, this utility can be abused in order to side load a custom version of "xwizards.dll".
sigmahq/proc_creation_win_xwizard_execut.label: Xwizard.EXE Execution From Non-Default Location

timokoessler/mongodb-bf_auth-db-enum.name: timokoessler/mongodb-bf_auth-db-enum
timokoessler/mongodb-bf_auth-db-enum.description: Detect mongodb authentication database enum bruteforce
timokoessler/mongodb-bf_auth-db-enum.label: MongoDB Authentication Enumeration

timokoessler/uptime-kuma-bf_user-enum.name: timokoessler/uptime-kuma-bf_user-enum
timokoessler/uptime-kuma-bf_user-enum.description: Detect Uptime Kuma user enum bruteforce
timokoessler/uptime-kuma-bf_user-enum.label: Uptime Kuma User Enumeration
